We have file-level metadata: file path certbot-apache/certbot_apache/_internal/override_centos.py. Docstring: Distribution specific override class for CentOS family (RHEL, Fedora). Imports: certbot.errors, certbot.util, certbot_apache._internal.apache_util, certbot_apache._internal.configurator, certbot_apache._internal.configurator.OsOptions, certbot_apache._internal.parser, logging, typing.Any. Globals: class summaries: CentOSConfigurator and CentOSParser. Provide summary of module responsibilities: Provide CentOS-specific overrides for Apache configurator and parser, handling version detection, command overrides, restart handling, validation, sysconfig modifications.

Business intent: To enable Certbot's Apache plugin to correctly manage Apache on CentOS-based distributions, ensuring proper command execution, service management, configuration validation, and parsing of CentOS-specific sysconfig files.

Keywords: CentOS, RHEL, Fedora, Apache configurator, Certbot, override, parser, sysconfig, service restart, version detection, configuration validation.

Summary: "Provides CentOS‑family specific extensions to the Certbot Apache plugin, customizing configurator behavior and parser handling for RHEL/Fedora environments."

Business intent: "Ensures Certbot can correctly configure, validate, and restart Apache on CentOS‑based systems by overriding generic operations with distribution‑aware logic, including version detection, service management, and sysconfig file updates."
